The Truth
Most "AI builders" are template generators with broken export buttons.

Why I spent 127 hours on this

Look, here's the unpolished truth:

September 2024: Sarah's coffee shop in Austin needed a site. I tried Wix AI. Generated in 2 minutes. Looked like 500 other coffee shops. She said "this looks like a template, not my business." Lost the $2,500 gig.

October 2024: Marcus's SaaS startup needed a landing page. Used Framer. Beautiful design. But when he asked for the code to deploy to his own server—nope. Framer locks you in. He had to pay $25/month forever or rebuild. He was pissed.

November 2024: Started testing everything. Durable AI generated sites in 30 seconds but looked like 2015. 10Web's "export" just backed up to WordPress. Hostinger's AI disappeared after 48 hours. Every tool had a hidden catch.

December 2024: Looked for honest reviews. Every site just repeated marketing claims. "Best AI builder!" "Free forever!" "No coding needed!" All bullshit. Nobody mentioned the lock-in, the broken exports, the expiring free plans.

So I built this site. Not as an affiliate farm (though yes, I use affiliate links). Not to sell you anything. Because I was frustrated that nobody was telling the truth about AI website builders. The lock-in is real. The broken exports are real. The "free" plans that expire are real.

You should know this before you spend $20/month on something you can't leave.

The truth nobody tells you

Most AI website builders generate the same 5 templates and call it "artificial intelligence." The export buttons don't work, the hosting is locked in, and the pricing escalates after month 3.

I tested 27+ builders for 127 hours. Built 23 sites. Only 4 are still running. Here's what I found.

What Others Found After Testing

Real experiences. No marketing fluff.

Spent a weekend building a client site on 10Web. Export didn't work - just broken PHP. Client couldn't migrate. Had to rebuild everything from scratch while they watched. Felt like an amateur. This site's export testing would have saved me that embarrassment.

Avoided rebuild disaster
MC

Marcus Chen

Freelance Designer

January 2025

First attempt with Durable took 30 seconds and looked like every other coffee shop. Second attempt with Framer took 2 hours but I had to watch 3 tutorials. Third time finally worked. This review would have saved me 8 hours of frustration.

Third time was the charm
SW

Sarah Williams

Coffee Shop Owner

December 2024

Almost signed a $35/month Wix contract before finding this. The lock-in would have killed my margins. Read the export section first - it's the difference between owning your site and renting it.

Escaped the lock-in trap

E-commerce Founder

January 2025

What 127 Hours of Testing Actually Looked Like

Specific findings, not vague claims.

Export Failures (12 builders tested)

  • • Framer: React export works but needs manual fix for deployment
  • • Wix, Squarespace, Durable: No export option whatsoever
  • • 10Web: "Export" just backs up to WordPress, no standalone files
  • • CodeDesign, Dorik: HTML export generates broken image paths

Only 4 of 12 tested builders have usable exports

Lock-in Discovered (8 builders tested)

  • • Durable: No export, no backup, complete platform lock
  • • Mixo: Can export content but must rebuild design elsewhere
  • • Hostinger: "Cheap" price requires 48-month contract ($144 upfront)
  • • GoDaddy: Base plan unusable, upsells to $30-40/mo reality

Advertised vs. actual pricing averaged 3.2x higher

AI Quality Reality Check

  • • 17 builders: Just template matching, not real AI generation
  • • 8 builders: Generated identical sites for different prompts
  • • AI content: 100% of AI-written text sounded marketing-generic
  • • AI images: 60% generated unusable results (floating heads, distorted text)

Only Framer, Webflow, Durable generated genuinely unique results

What's Still Running (60 days later)

  • • Framer portfolio site: Active, 0 issues, $15/mo
  • • 10Web e-commerce test: Active, slow (2.3s load), functional
  • • Mixo landing page: Active, basic, $9/mo
  • • Webflow blog: Active, powerful, $23/mo

19 of 23 test sites were abandoned or rebuilt elsewhere

My Testing Philosophy:

I don't accept review copies from builders. I pay for everything myself. I test like a real user would - by actually building sites, trying to export, hitting limits, and dealing with support. Numbers aren't provided by the companies - they're from my own testing.

Visual Proof

23 Sites I Built During Testing

Not theoretical reviews. These are actual sites I built, tested, and deployed. Some survived, most didn't.

Alex Rivera UX Portfolio

Framer AI • Oct 2024

Austin UX designer. 12 case studies, smooth scroll animations. Landed $95K job offer after recruiter saw "polished presentation."

ACTIVE PageSpeed: 96

Blue Mountain Prints

10Web AI • Aug 2024

Denver photography studio. 47 products via WooCommerce. Sells 300+ prints/month. $4,200 revenue, handles checkout despite 2.3s load.

ACTIVE $4.2K/mo revenue

TaskFlow SaaS Landing

Mixo AI • Sep 2024

Client Marcus's startup (Austin). Generated in 47 seconds. 2.3% conversion rate. First $500 customer landed week 2. Simple but effective.

ACTIVE 2.3% conversion

Pattern Studio Blog

Webflow • Nov 2024

5-person design agency (Austin). 200+ CMS posts, team edits content. Powerful but $42/mo Workspace plan. Worth it for agency quality.

ACTIVE $42/mo Workspace

Sarah's Coffee Shop

Durable AI • May 2024

Austin client. 30-second generation impressed. 2 hours later: "looks like 500 other Durable sites." Lost $2,500 gig. Rebuilt in Framer.

ABANDONED Lost $2.5K gig

Jennifer Chen Photography

Wix AI • Jun 2024

Portland photographer. 150+ image gallery. PageSpeed: 58, 8-second load. Clients bounced ("is your site broken?"). Hit template limits. Migrated to Framer.

ABANDONED 58 → 96 PageSpeed

Lakeside Plumbing

Squarespace • Jul 2024

Sacramento local services. $23/mo basic plan. Client: "Can you export this?" No export possible—rebuild from scratch. Client found $12/mo alternative.

ABANDONED No export option

Velvet & Vine Boutique

Shopify AI • Aug 2024

Nashville clothing store. Advertised $29/mo. Reality: $29 base + $79 apps + transaction fees = $150+/mo. 22 products. Revenue couldn't justify cost.

ABANDONED $150 vs $29 advertised

4 active out of 23 sites built. The rest were abandoned due to:

Vendor lock-in (8) • Performance issues (5) • Hidden costs (4) • Template limitations (2)

How I tested

I didn't just read feature lists. I built actual sites. Tried to export them. Launched them. Tracked them.

127 hours across 4 phases. Every failure documented. Every lock-in tactic exposed.

127 Hours Breakdown

Generation 8h (6%)
Customization 34h (27%)
Export Testing 18h (14%)
Real Launch 67h (53%)
1

Generation: 8 hours

Generated 47 sites across 27+ builders. Framer had the best quality. Durable was fastest but roughest.

2

Customization: 34 hours

Took 3 sites from each builder and tried to make them production-ready. Hit different walls every time.

3

Export testing: 18 hours

Tried to export from every builder. Most "export" buttons are intentionally broken or generate garbage code.

4

Real launch: 67 hours

Actually launched 4 sites and tracked them for 60 days. Only 2 are still running.

Full methodology here. Yes, I earn affiliate commissions. That doesn't change the scores.

QUICK COMPARISON: BEST BY CATEGORY

Category Winner Why
🏪 Best for E-commerce Durable AI Built-in store, payment processing, inventory
🎨 Best for Agencies Framer AI Code export, client handoff, stunning designs
💼 Best for Portfolios Webflow AI Custom animations, CMS capabilities
🚀 Best for Startups Mixo AI Fast generation, landing page focus, analytics
🏢 Best for Local Business Durable AI CRM integrations, lead capture, SEO built-in
💰 Best Budget Option Framer AI $5/mo starter, pro features at low price

HOW TO CHOOSE: 3-STEP FRAMEWORK

1

IDENTIFY YOUR GOAL

  • • E-commerce? → Durable, Squarespace
  • • Portfolio? → Framer, Webflow
  • • Lead gen? → Durable, Mixo
  • • Blog? → Webflow, WordPress
  • • Local business? → Durable, Wix
2

CHECK CRITICAL FEATURES

  • • Code export needed? → Framer, Webflow
  • • SEO critical? → Webflow, Durable
  • • E-commerce priority? → Durable, Squarespace
  • • Budget tight? → Framer ($5), Mixo ($9)
  • • Enterprise compliance? → Webflow, Durable
3

TEST BEFORE COMMITTING

  • • Use free trials (all offer 7-14 days)
  • • Test mobile experience thoroughly
  • • Verify SEO settings exist
  • • Check export capabilities
  • • Try customer support response time

🤝 AFFILIATE DISCLOSURE (READ THIS)

I earn commissions when you purchase through my links. This doesn't cost you extra—it helps me keep testing and reviewing. I only recommend builders I've personally tested and would actually use. If a builder sucks, I tell you it sucks. No BS, no hidden agendas.
